Package com.glyart.mystral.database

Class AsyncDatabase

java.lang.Object
com.glyart.mystral.database.AsyncDatabase
All Implemented Interfaces:
AsyncDataOperations
public class AsyncDatabase extends Object implements AsyncDataOperations
Represents implementation of basic asynchronous operations for interacting with a data source.

An instance of AsyncDatabase is available by passing a valid DataSource and an implementation of the Executor interface.

This class:

  • works asynchronously, without overhead on the main thread. This is done by using Executor.execute(Runnable)
  • executes all the CRUD operations on a data source
  • handles exceptions and communicates the sql that generated the problem (if possible)
  • gives not null CompletableFuture objects that WILL STORE usable future results
  • iterates over ResultSets
  • deals with static and prepared statements

Methods of this class use various callback interfaces. A reading of those is greatly suggested.
Since the callback interfaces make AsyncDatabase's methods parameterizable, there should be no need to subclass this class.

See Also:
Executor, CompletableFuture, BatchSetter, ParametrizedBatchSetter, PreparedStatementFunction, PreparedStatementCreator, ResultSetExtractor, ResultSetRowMapper, StatementFunction

      Constructs a new AsyncDatabase instance by wrapping the given DataSource object in the default Database implementation.
      Parameters:
      dataSource - a valid DataSource instance
      executor - an implementation of Executor used to create new threads for executing the asynchronous JDBC operations.
      See Also:
      Executor

  • Method Details

    • getDatabase

      public Optional<Database> getDatabase()
      Returns the Database class instance which wraps the given DataSource's instance.
      This method can return an empty Optional if the AsyncDatabase(DataOperations, Executor) constructor is used to create a new instance of this class.
      Returns:
      the Database (it can be used for synchronous operations).
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if there is no Database available
      See Also:
      Optional

    • getDataSource

      public Optional<DataSource> getDataSource()
      Returns an Optional instance containing the DataSource used by this AsyncDatabase's instance. The AsyncDatabase class can obtain the DataSource from the DataOperations implementation.
      If that implementation is neither an instance of DataSourceSupplier nor DatabaseAccessor then an empty Optional will be returned.
      Returns:
      the DataSource
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if there was a problem while trying to retrieve the DataSource's instance
      See Also:
      Optional

      Description copied from interface: AsyncDataOperations
      Executes a JDBC data access operation, implemented as StatementFunction callback, using an active connection. The callback CAN return a result object (if it exists), for example a single object or a collection of objects.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the result type
      Parameters:
      callback - a callback that holds the operation logic
      Returns:
      a never null CompletableFuture object which holds: an object returned by the callback, or null if it's not available

      DataAccessException - if there is any problem

      Specified by:

      getGeneratedKeys - a boolean value
      Returns:
      a never null CompletableFuture object which holds: the number of the affected rows. If getGeneratedKeys is true, this method will return the key of the new generated row

    • queryOrElseGet

      public <T> CompletableFuture<T> queryOrElseGet​(@NotNull @NotNull String sql, ResultSetExtractor<T> extractor, @NotNull @NotNull Supplier<T> supplier)
      Description copied from interface: AsyncDataOperations
      Executes a query given static SQL statement, then it reads the ResultSet using the ResultSetExtractor implementation.

      If a null result is returned, then the given supplier will be invoked, supplying the specified result (it can be null) inside the CompletableFuture.

      Specified by:
      queryOrElseGet in interface AsyncDataOperations
      Type Parameters:
      T - the result type
      Parameters:
      sql - the query to execute
      extractor - a callback that will extract all rows from the ResultSet
      supplier - the supplier of another result
      Returns:
      a never null CompletableFuture object which holds: a result object (if it exists), according to the ResultSetExtractor (or the supplier) implementation, otherwise the result of the supplier invocation

    • update

      public CompletableFuture<Integer> update​(@NotNull @NotNull PreparedStatementCreator creator, @Nullable @Nullable PreparedStatementSetter setter, boolean getGeneratedKey) throws DataAccessException
      Description copied from interface: AsyncDataOperations
      Performs a single update operation (like insert, delete, update) using a PreparedStatementCreator to provide SQL and any required parameters. A PreparedStatementSetter can be passed as helper that sets bind parameters.
      Specified by:
      update in interface AsyncDataOperations
      Parameters:
      creator - a callback that provides the PreparedStatement with bind parameters
      setter - a helper that sets bind parameters. If it's null then this will be an update with static SQL
      getGeneratedKey - a boolean value
      Returns:
      a never null CompletableFuture object which holds: the number of the affected rows. If getGeneratedKeys is true, this method will return the key of the new generated row
      Throws:
      DataAccessException - if there is any problem

      update in interface AsyncDataOperations
      Parameters:
      sql - the SQL containing bind parameters
      params - arguments to be bind to the given SQL

      sqlTypes - an integer array containing the type of the query's parameters, expressed as Types

    • batchUpdate

      public CompletableFuture<Void> batchUpdate​(@NotNull @NotNull String sql, @NotNull @NotNull BatchSetter batchSetter) throws IllegalStateException
      Description copied from interface: AsyncDataOperations
      Performs multiple update operations using a single SQL statement.

      NOTE: this method will be unusable if the driver doesn't support batch updates.

      Specified by:
      batchUpdate in interface AsyncDataOperations
      Parameters:
      sql - the SQL containing bind parameters. It will be reused because all statements in a batch use the same SQL
      batchSetter - a callback that sets parameters on the PreparedStatement created by this method
      Returns:
      a CompletableFuture object. It can be used to know when the batch update is done and if an exception occurred
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the driver doesn't support batch updates

    • batchUpdate

      public CompletableFuture<Void> batchUpdate​(@NotNull @NotNull String sql, @Nullable @Nullable List<Object[]> batchArgs, int... sqlTypes) throws IllegalStateException
      Description copied from interface: AsyncDataOperations
      Performs multiple update operations using a single SQL statement.
      Specified by:
      batchUpdate in interface AsyncDataOperations
      Parameters:
      sql - The SQL containing bind parameters. It will be reused because all statements in a batch use the same SQL
      batchArgs - A list of object arrays containing the batch arguments
      sqlTypes - an integer array containing the type of the query's parameters, expressed as Types
      Returns:
      A CompletableFuture object. It can be used for knowing when the batch update is done and if an exception occurred
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - If the driver doesn't support batch updates

    • batchUpdate

      public <T> CompletableFuture<Void> batchUpdate​(@NotNull @NotNull String sql, @Nullable @Nullable List<T> batchArgs, @NotNull @NotNull ParametrizedBatchSetter<T> paramsBatchSetter) throws IllegalStateException
      Description copied from interface: AsyncDataOperations
      Performs multiple update operations using a single SQL statement.
      Specified by:
      batchUpdate in interface AsyncDataOperations
      Type Parameters:
      T - the parameter type
      Parameters:
      sql - the SQL containing bind parameters. It will be reused because all statements in a batch use the same SQL
      batchArgs - a list of objects containing the batch arguments
      paramsBatchSetter - a callback that sets parameters on the PreparedStatement created by this method
      Returns:
      a CompletableFuture object. It can be used for knowing when the batch update is done and if an exception occurred
      Throws:

    • query

      public <T> CompletableFuture<T> query​(@NotNull @NotNull PreparedStatementCreator creator, @Nullable @Nullable PreparedStatementSetter setter, @NotNull @NotNull ResultSetExtractor<T> extractor) throws DataAccessException
      Description copied from interface: AsyncDataOperations
      Executes a query using a PreparedStatement, created by a PreparedStatementCreator and with his values set by a PreparedStatementSetter.

      Most other query methods use this method, but application code will always work with either a creator or a setter.

      Specified by:
      query in interface AsyncDataOperations
      Type Parameters:
      T - the result type
      Parameters:
      creator - a callback that creates a PreparedStatement
      setter - a callback that sets values on the PreparedStatement. If null, the SQL will be treated as static SQL with no bind parameters
      extractor - a callback that will extract results given a ResultSet
      Returns:
      a never null CompletableFuture object which holds: a result object (if it exists), according to the ResultSetExtractor implementation
      Throws:
      DataAccessException - if there is any problem
      See Also:
      PreparedStatementSetter

      Description copied from interface: AsyncDataOperations
      Executes a query using an SQL statement, then reading the ResultSet with a ResultSetExtractor implementation.
      Specified by:
      query in interface AsyncDataOperations
      Type Parameters:
      T - the result type
      Parameters:
      sql - the query to execute
      setter - a callback that sets values on the PreparedStatement. If null, the SQL will be treated as static SQL with no bind parameters
      extractor - a callback that will extract results given a ResultSet
      Returns:
      a never null CompletableFuture object which holds: a result object (if it exists), according to the ResultSetExtractor implementation
      Throws:
      DataAccessException - if there is any problem

    • query

      public <T> CompletableFuture<List<T>> query​(@NotNull @NotNull String sql, @Nullable @Nullable PreparedStatementSetter pss, @NotNull @NotNull ResultSetRowMapper<T> resultSetRowMapper) throws DataAccessException
      Description copied from interface: AsyncDataOperations
      Executes a query using an SQL statement and a PreparedStatementSetter implementation that will bind values to the query. Each row of the ResultSet will be mapped to a result object via a ResultSetRowMapper implementation.
      Specified by:
      query in interface AsyncDataOperations
      Type Parameters:
      T - the result type
      Parameters:
      sql - the query to execute
      pss - a callback that sets values on the PreparedStatement. If null, the SQL will be treated as static SQL with no bind parameters
      resultSetRowMapper - a callback that will map one object per ResultSet row
      Returns:
      a never null CompletableFuture object which holds: a result list containing mapped objects (if they exist)
      Throws:
      DataAccessException - if there is any problem

    • queryOrElseGet

      public <T> CompletableFuture<T> queryOrElseGet​(@NotNull @NotNull String sql, @Nullable @Nullable Object[] args, @NotNull @NotNull ResultSetExtractor<T> extractor, Supplier<T> supplier, int... sqlTypes) throws DataAccessException
      Description copied from interface: AsyncDataOperations
      Executes a query given an SQL statement: it will be used to create a PreparedStatement. Then a list of arguments with their sql Types will be bound to the query. The ResultSetExtractor implementation will read the ResultSet.

      If a null result is returned, then the given supplier will be invoked, supplying the specified result (it can be null) inside the CompletableFuture.

      Specified by:
      queryOrElseGet in interface AsyncDataOperations
      Type Parameters:
      T - the result type
      Parameters:
      sql - the query to execute
      args - arguments to bind to the query
      extractor - a callback that will extract results given a ResultSet
      supplier - the supplier of another result
      sqlTypes - an integer array containing the type of the query's parameters, expressed as Types
      Returns:
      a never null CompletableFuture object which holds: a result object (if it exists), according to the ResultSetExtractor implementation, otherwise the result of the supplier invocation
      Throws:
      DataAccessException - if there is any problem
      See Also:
      Types

    • queryForObject

      public <T> CompletableFuture<T> queryForObject​(@NotNull @NotNull String sql, Object[] args, @NotNull @NotNull ResultSetRowMapper<T> resultSetRowMapper) throws DataAccessException
      Description copied from interface: AsyncDataOperations
      Executes a query given an SQL statement: it will be used to create a PreparedStatement. Then a list of arguments will be bound to the query.

      The first ResultSet row will be mapped to a result object using the ResultSetRowMapper implementation.

      The ResultSet must have exactly ONE row.
      Specified by:
      queryForObject in interface AsyncDataOperations
      Type Parameters:
      T - the result type
      Parameters:
      sql - the query to execute
      args - arguments to bind to the query
      resultSetRowMapper - a callback that will map one object per ResultSet row
      Returns:
      a never null CompletableFuture object which holds: a mapped result object (if it exists)
      Throws:
      DataAccessException - if there is any problem

    • queryForObjectOrElseGet

      public <T> CompletableFuture<T> queryForObjectOrElseGet​(@NotNull @NotNull String sql, Object[] args, ResultSetRowMapper<T> resultSetRowMapper, @NotNull @NotNull Supplier<T> supplier, int... sqlTypes)
      Description copied from interface: AsyncDataOperations
      Executes a query given an SQL statement: it will be used to create a PreparedStatement. Then a list of arguments with their sql Types will be bound to the query.

      The first ResultSet row will be mapped to a result object using the ResultSetRowMapper implementation.

      The ResultSet mustn't have more than ONE row.

      If a null result is returned, then the given supplier will be invoked, supplying the specified result (it can be null).

      Specified by:
      queryForObjectOrElseGet in interface AsyncDataOperations
      Type Parameters:
      T - the result type
      Parameters:
      sql - the query to execute
      args - arguments to bind to the query
      resultSetRowMapper - a callback that will map one object per ResultSet row
      supplier - the supplier of another result
      sqlTypes - an integer array containing the type of the query's parameters, expressed as Types
      Returns:
      a never null CompletableFuture object which holds: a mapped result object (if it exists), otherwise the result of the supplier invocation
